2.caption_en:
A large typographic poster states that the system being built now will not be the same system you run in six months or two years. The quote is presented in white italic text on a dark blue-gray background.

{
  "type": "quote_poster",
  "quote_text": "You have to understand that the system you're building now is not the system you will be running in 6 months or 2 years.",
  "attribution_present": true,
  "attribution_text": "[redacted]",
  "attribution_note": "Attribution text appears in the image but the individual's name is withheld to avoid identifying a real person.",
  "visual_description": {
    "background_color": "dark blue-gray",
    "text_color": "white",
    "font_style": "italic, sans-serif",
    "layout": "left-aligned, multi-line, large display text"
  },
  "language": "English",
  "source": "image_region",
  "ocr_notes": "OCR of the attribution was noisy; name omitted for privacy despite visible attribution."
}

4.caption_en:
A slide displaying a quote that warns builders the system they create now won't be the same one they'll run in six months or two years, attributed to Werner Vogels (CTO, Amazon.com).
